Summary: Half mile wide triangle lands north of Nampa.
divs: sighting detailsas i drove to work at 12:45 am, (i can't remember the exact date but it was sometime in the first half of september 2010), northbound on midland rd. between greenhurst and locust roads, there is a hill on the road that overlooks the city of nampa, id. as soon as i reached the top of that hill my eyes were immediately drawn to a large triangle shaped object that had a large glowing -white- light at each corner of the triangle. the lights i immediately noticed as unusual because the whiteness of them contrasted with all the other artificial lights of the city. when i saw the object it's approximate altitude was 500 to 1000 feet steadily descending until it dropped below the ridgeline\treeline at the far end of town. i could still see the glow from behind the trees for a couple of seconds before it went out. from my vantage point it was just west of the sugar beet factory which also lies beyond this ridgeline so i am quite confident making an estimation of the size of the object at one-half mile wide.
